N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 312.4 - Spreading of income, revenue, and expense items

State Regulations

When the amount of any unusual item includible in the
income, operating revenue, or operating expense accounts is relatively so large
that its inclusion in the accounts for the year in which the transactions
occurred, would seriously distort net income, the company may request
permission to include all or a part of the amount in account 186, miscellaneous
deferred debits, or account 253, other deferred credits to be amortized over
such period and through such accounts as the commission shall determine. Without permission of this commission, no such item shall be carried beyond the
calendar year in which the transaction occurred. Notes
